page.title: 15A Newcomer's View.
page.content: Emma's Mum gave us a newcomer's view of the village. They moved to West Ashton 8yrs ago. They wanted an "Out of Town" place to live when her husband's employment moved to Bath, and West Ashton "felt right". They live in one of the new houses just in- side our block. They settled in easily as the "locals" made them very welcome However they find it harder to mix with other newcomers who tend to isolate themselves. " There is the feeling of two separate communuties in the village, also a general reluctance for community involvement." The family enjoys the close prox- imity of the countryside, especially the bonus of abundant wildlife that visits the garden. Mrs.T's hobby is gardening and she has a part time job taking aerobics classes in Trowbridge and Frome.
